chapter.p: 81 “At that time,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh, “they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of its officials, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Judah from their graves. 2And they shall spread them out before the sun, and before the moon, and before all the host of heaven, which they have loved, and which they have served, and which they have gone after, and which they have inquired about, and to which they have bowed in worship. They shall not be gathered, and they shall not be buried; they will be like dung on the surface of the ground. 3And death will be preferred to life by all the remaining of this evil clanOr “family” in all the remaining places where I have driven them away,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
4“And you shall say to them, ‘Thus asksOr “says” Yahweh:

ul.li1: “Do men fall and not stand up?
ul.li2: If one turns away does he not return?
ul.li1: 5Why has this people, Jerusalem, turned away in enduring apostasy?
ul.li2: They have kept hold of deceit, they have refused to return.Or “repent”
ul.li1: 6I have listened attentively,
ul.li2: and I have listened.
ul.li1: They do not speak honestly,
ul.li2: there is no man who regrets his wickedness, saying, ‘What have I done?’
ul.li1: All of them are turning to their ways of running,
ul.li2: like a horse plunging into battle.
ul.li1: 7Even the stork in heaven knows its appointed time,
ul.li2: and the turtledove, and the swallow, and the song bird,
ul.li1: they observe the time of their coming.
ul.li2: But my people do not know the ordinanceOr “law” of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 8How can you say, ‘We are wise and the law of Yahweh is with us’?
ul.li2: Look, surely the lying stylus of the scribesLiterally “stylus of lie of scribes” has made it a lie.
ul.li1: 9The wise will be put to shame,
ul.li2: they will be dismayed,
and they will get taken.
ul.li1: Look, they have rejected the word of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and what is wisdom to them?
ul.li1: 10Therefore I will give their wives to others,
ul.li2: their fields to conquerors,
ul.li1: because from the smallest to the greatest,
ul.li2: all of them make profit for unlawful gain,
ul.li1: from prophet to priest,
ul.li2: all of them practice deceit.
ul.li1: 11And they have treated the wound of the daughter of my people lightly,
ul.li2: saying,Literally “to say” ‘Peace, peace,’ but there is no peace.
ul.li1: 12Were they ashamed, for they had committed a detestable thing?
ul.li2: What’s worse,Or “also” they were not ashamed at all,
ul.li1: and they did not know to feel humiliated.
ul.li2: ThereforeLiterally “To thus” they will fall among those who fall;
at the time of their punishment they will stumble,” says Yahweh.
ul.li1: 13“I will take away their harvest,”Literally “I will take away, I will make an end to them” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
“There are no grapes on the vine,
ul.li2: and there are no figs on the fig tree,
ul.li1: and the leaves wither,
ul.li2: and what I gave to them passed over them.” ’ ”

chapter.pericope: The Nation Longs for Yahweh’s Help

ul.li1: 14Why are we sitting?
ul.li2: Gather, and let us go into the fortified cities,
ul.li1: and let us perish there,
ul.li2: for Yahweh our God has caused us to perish,
ul.li1: and has provided drink for us, water of poison,
ul.li2: because we have sinned against Yahweh.
ul.li1: 15We hope for peace,
ul.li2: but there is no good,
ul.li1: for a time of healing,
ul.li2: but there is terror.
ul.li1: 16“From Dan is heard the snorting of their horses,
ul.li2: from the sound of the neighing of their stallions all the land quakes,
ul.li1: for they come and devour the land,
ul.li2: and that which fills the city,
and those who live in it.
ul.li1: 17For look, I am letting loose among you snakes,
ul.li2: adders for which there is no incantation,
and they will bite you,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 18“My comfort is gone from me,
ul.li2: sorrow is on me,
my heart is sick.
ul.li1: 19Look, the sound of the cry for help of the daughter of my people
ul.li2: from a distant land,
ul.li1: ‘Is Yahweh not in Zion?
ul.li2: Is her king not in her?’
ul.li1: Why have they provoked me to anger with their images,
ul.li2: with idols of a foreign land?”
ul.li1: 20The harvest has passed,
ul.li2: the summer has come to an end,
ul.li1: and we have not received help.Or “been saved”
21“Because of the wound of the daughter of my people I am broken down,
ul.li2: I mourn, horror has seized me.
ul.li1: 22Is there no balm in Gilead?
ul.li2: Is there no healer there?
ul.li1: Why, then, has the healing of the daughter of my people not been restored?
